metadata.Title: CVE-2023-6039 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in lan78xx_disconnect indrivers/net/usb/lan78xx.c in the network sub-component, net/usb/lan78xx inthe Linux Kernel. This flaw allows a local attacker to crash the systemwhen the LAN78XX USB device detaches.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6039` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1017-aws - 6.2.0-1017.17~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1018-azure - 6.2.0-1018.18~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1018-azure-fde - 6.2.0-1018.18~22.04.1.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1003-oem - 6.5.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
linux-hwe-6.2 package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-kvm package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-allwinner-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life').
linux-aws package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-6.2').
linux-aws-6.2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1017.17~22.04.1').
linux-azure package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
